summary: The Canberra Embassy is mentioned in the context of a recommendation against declassifying Warren Commission document CD-971. Sir Charles Spry of the Australian Security Intelligence Organization (ASIO) raised concerns regarding the investigation of anonymous telephone calls to the Canberra Embassy both before and after President Kennedy's assassination. These concerns led to a recommendation against declassification of the document, as detailed in multiple memoranda to the Director of Central Intelligence.
significance: The Canberra Embassy is significant in the JFK assassination context because it was the target of anonymous telephone calls both before and after the assassination. The investigation into these calls is documented in Warren Commission document CD-971, and concerns about this investigation led to a recommendation against declassifying the document.
